definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other

sentences.english: Hate does not feel disgusting of war.
sentences.chinese: 讨厌却不能撕破脸的感觉真恶心。

sentences.english: Have you sewn up the tear in my coat?
sentences.chinese: 你把我大衣上那个撕破的口子缝起来了吗？

sentences.english: The woman's screams tore through the swirling snow.
sentences.chinese: 那个女人的尖叫声撕破盘旋的飞雪。

sentences.english: His elbow was poking through his torn shirt sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 他的肘伸出了撕破的衬衣袖管。

sentences.english: After the summer solstice, in anticipation of rain, a rain canopy can be torn.
sentences.chinese: 夏至之后，在期待一场雨，一场能撕破天幕的雨。

sentences.english: Clerk says if I tear pages out of a book I have to buy it.
sentences.chinese: 店员说如果我撕破书页就必须把它买下。

sentences.english: I had chapped lips and I thought I was using chapstick .
sentences.chinese: 我的嘴唇被撕破我以为是长期使用筷子。

sentences.english: The flag on the building was split by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 楼顶上的旗子被大风撕破了。

sentences.english: She could knit a torn sleeve up.
Obstinate are the trammels, but my heart aches when I try to break them.
sentences.chinese: 罗网是坚韧的，但是要撕破它的时候我又要心痛。

sentences.english: We do not tear your clothing with machinery. We do it carefully by hand .
sentences.chinese: 我们不会用机器撕破你的衣服，我们会用手仔细去做。

sentences.english: He hunted butterflieseith a darting bt, only to break their wings.
sentences.chinese: 他用投射网捕抓蝴蝶，却撕破了它们的翅膀。

sentences.english: Louis's shirt was filthy, the trousers torn and the cap, long gone.
sentences.chinese: 路易斯的衬衫很脏，裤子撕破了，棒球帽不知去向。

sentences.english: The drayman's dog attacked the stranger, tearing his glove an dripping his trousers.
sentences.chinese: 车夫的狗袭击了陌生人，撕破了他的手套。

sentences.english: He tore at the wrappings of the package.
His leg was lacerated by the tiger's claws.
sentences.chinese: 他的腿被老虎的爪子撕破。

definition: to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to puncture/to pierce/(fig.) to destroy (the facade concealing an unpleasant reality)
to tear up/to tear to pieces
to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to wear out (clothes)/to pierce (a membrane etc)
lit. two segments with a single cut (idiom)/fig. to make a clean break (idiom)
